title: Need some help understanding an Icon in the loading screen.
body:
Okay, i don't know if this is the right place to post this, but i have a question/need help.
After champion select (I am playing normals as I'm level 15), In the loading screen, you can see the champions in the match. Under the champions icon there are the summoner spells. (ignite, flash, smite etc.) 
Next to those icons, there is another one, sometimes it is a cross, and some times it is a random (?) icon..
Can anyone explain to me what that icon is? (I am sorry if i didn't describe that properly :'(!)
I have not played since season 2 and a LOT has changed and I'm still getting the hang of the game again.

Thanks everyone in advance for your help :)

replies.body:
You're looking at keystone masteries. If you don't have one (which many wouldn't at lvl 15, you need to be I think lvl 18 to get one) they show up as an X.

The keystone masteries are basically the top tier masteries, they have a much bigger impact on gameplay now (especially in early lane trading) so Riot put them on the loading screen and in the TAB menu so you can be very aware of them.

Masteries got a complete overhaul with the S6 update so that change was implemented in preseason this year :)
Thank you, that is what i needed to know :)

Hey there,

Which icon were you referring to, I'll try to describe everything in the picture below for you

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/article_attachments/202150710/SS_Loading_Screen_Border.jpg

As you've already mentioned, you can see peoples summoner spells, to the left of those is the persons selected summoner icon, yours currently being this
https://avatar.leagueoflegends.com/oce/Derikay.png

Around each player is a border, which were part of ranked rewards for the previous season, In the top left is their mastery level for that champion (How much they've played them)

And finally in the top middle are the [honor ribbons](http://gameinfo.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/game-info/get-started/honor/).


Any questions?

Edit: Woooooopppppssss, forgot about keystones (Seras mentioned them in her above post)
